Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: freerain
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe and close to the airport. Shuttle service was great. No real perks, but that s okay. Customer service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for weary travelers”
Reviews.Author: Craig C
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for only one night recently. Very friendly and capable staff. Had a most enjoyable conversation with people in the restaurant/bar. Room was very clean and comfortable. All in all, a very nice place. Shuttle to Toronto Pearson airport is very fast and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Average is the best I can say”
Reviews.Author: DanielKOBrien
Reviews.Content: I regularily stay at this hotel and would say it is very average. Rooms are fine, location is o.k., restaurant is better than it used to be. There is a free shuttle from the airport, but you risk your life every time you get in it. Also, no matter how long they tell you to wait, it will be much longer. Value is good.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: AA_Delta
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times as a pit stop before early morning return flights home. It is fairly clean and located close to the terminals. If the weather is okay it's a short walk to some restaurants but there's no real shopping in the area. If you have a car then there are a number of places within a few minutes. The lobby area is fairly nice and the front desk staff were helpful. There is covered parking but the access from the parkade to the hotel is not very convenient and was incredible dirty. You may end up in a hallway with several 90 degree turns before you get in the hotel. The rooms are updated but there are signs of loose flooring, poor sealing in the shower and fixtures that are worn. The HVAC doesn't seem to have been improved at all. I'm not sure I get this brand in the Priority Club scheme. From a required points perspective it seems like it should be on the more upscale side yet this property seems like a converted motel. The rooms are updated with hardword floors and a decent decor but I have been in many Holiday Inn Express hotels for less money/points that are much newer and better appointed. I will probably continue to stay but only for 1 night at a time to sleep before a flight. It's acceptable but there a lot of other choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Tropical_Tammy073
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very friendly, clean and conveniently located next to the airport. I was here for business but would definitely come back to this hotel to stay before heading out of town on vacation. The only downside is that the shuttle doesn't run 24 hours a day so may be a bit of a problem if you had an early morning flight. The biggest downside to this hotel is that noise in the hallways (people talking, doors closing) often permeates into the rooms. I found the third floor was the worst for this. It also depends on the courtesy of the other guests, too. The rooms have great work space for setting up a computer and free wireless internet. The showers are hot and good water pressure and they have proper hair dryers instead of those useless wall-mounted ones most hotels have. The dining room is a little slow at breakfast as they usually only have one server, but the food is good. Plan a little extra time at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “close & clean”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandWilds
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle 24 hours a day, only 2-3 minutes away. The restaurant had good food & rooms were recently upgraded. you can purchase sandwiches in the lobby also. If you feel you need to go out there is a Hooter's 4 buildings down. have booked here again in 1 months time, very inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay the night-park for a week”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Elly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before we flew out of the country for a weeks vacation. They have an option for 30.00-35.00 more added to your room stay to keep your car in a covered parking garage for the time we were gone. I have heard terrible stories of the park & Fly at the airport so we tried it. The hotel was clean and simple. We had drinks in the lounge that night and watched the super bowl. They gave us a number to call when we returned to the airport the following week and picked us up and returned us to our car, which was safely waiting for us. Great idea, clean hotel. Will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, interesting hotel, great manager!”
Reviews.Author: umfalvo
Reviews.Content: We were in TO for a convention and booked this hotel through the convention website. The convention screwed up and didn't make the reservation with Indigo. We found this out at 11:30pm after driving for 6 hours. The assistant manager was unbelievably rude and lazy, and did not want to even acknowledge that there was an issue. He just wanted to distance himself from the problem and kept asking us for a confirmation number or deflecting us to other people. Finally we managed to get him to let us spend one night there so we could try and find another hotel in the morning. In the morning we found the hotel manager (not the assistant) who was a true gentlemen, and had the right attitude for the hospitality industry. He explained that it was his job to make sure anything that could be done would be done. It was a breath of fresh air, and restored my faith in the hotel. In the end he found a way to get us into a room for the whole stay and it all worked out. I would have given 5 stars if we didn't have to endure that assistant manager the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mannycanuk
Reviews.Content: When I arrived a plane happened to be landing at the airport revealing that the hotel is under the flight path. Despite that, the room was very quiet. The location on the flight path was not an issue. The arrival area is small, so instead of transferring my bags to my room from the lobby, I parked the car in the garage and hiked to my room. This was the only negative of the trip in that I to walk a fair way. The garage connects to the hotelâ€™s second level and I was on the 4th and in a room near the centre of the hotel. Iâ€™m not sure how they would do it, but being able to take your bags out at the main door and up to your room before parking would be a bonus. One way to improve things would be to assign parking patrons to rooms with numbers above 30. Then the hike is considerably shorter. At the desk, I was greeted by a friendly and efficient desk staff that made check-in fast but had to make me aware of the $10 charge for parking. A little disappointed with that but they have to pay for the parking garage I guess. The room was brightly appointed with unique murals and bed stand lamps. The bathroom was unique in that there was no fully closed shower stall, just a half glass barrier. No problem with spashing, though. The sink drain must have been clogged because it was slow. Outlet on desk top lamp does not work. Parking lot costs $10 plus it can be far from the rooms numbering less than 30. The restaurant was nicely appointed and the server was friendly and accommodating. I ordered the tilapia which was very nicely prepared with crisp vegetables and roasted potatoes. I finished with the tasty lava cake with ice cream.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Location”
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel six or seven times while in the GTA on business. The location of the hotel is very good, and the covered parking is nice in the winter. The decor is similar to other Indigo hotels (hardwood floors, open shower, white desk chair). This particular hotel has service issues - occasionally there have been missing towels and soap in the rooms, or something was missed when the room was cleaned up. Probably just training issues with new housekeeping staff, but if this is the case they need to up their supervision. On a somewhat picky note, the staff at the front desk have been ambivalent, at best, as to new guests checking in. Not a huge deal, but if you like to be warmly greeted when you get to a new hotel, this is not the place for you. The building is old, and very oddly designed. Someone posted that the top five floors were removed at one point due to air traffic at Pearson. This actually makes sense, as the building is odd looking and to get to the top to floors requires two elevators, even though there are only five or six floors. It is also very unattractive from the outside, but clean inside. The rooms are surprisingly quiet considering that airplanes are coming directly over the building and not very far above it. Overall a very average hotel at best. If you are Priority Club Platinum they will reduce parking to $5.00 / night, but they will NOT do this automatically - you have to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Never a complaint”
Reviews.Author: londonontario
Reviews.Content: We are staying here again on Feb,2 we have stayed here since 2006 , and never have had a issue as a couple or a group of 20.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Jack7205
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a park and fly booking mid January. The hotel is clean and very simple furnishings. The only issue was the person who opened the restuarant. This staff member just pushed open the door and turned and went back inside without saying anything. No other issues.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: vjmToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight for an early flight out. Tony at the front desk was very helpful. We wanted the 0430 shuttle but were told it was full so we had to take the 0400. This earlier shuttle actually became a Godsend for reasons I won't go into, but it had nothing to do with the hotel. Had a nice dinner at the hotel restaurant. Was able to get good parking on the first covered level. We both loved the bed...so comfy cozy...didn't want to get out of it when our wake up call came. We found the room to be perfectly adequate for our short stay. When we arrived back home, we called for the shuttle and were told it would be a 30 minute wait due to traffic and weather, to stand inside the doors and someone would come for us. Within 15 minutes, someone was there to pick us up in a personal vehicle, because there were problems with shuttle van. We were very impressed. We didn't have time to use the pool, so can't comment. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would stay again, oh and yes the planes do land almost on top of you, fun to watch, but didn't find the noise bothersome...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: klein3
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at this hotel for our 6 am flight and everything was great about it. the rooms are clean and nicely furnished. be warned that they advertised underground parking but there is only 3 small area for it, so we were stuck outside, wasn't that impressed when we arrived but it barely snowed while we were gone so worked out alright. Also the shuttle to and from the airport doesn't run between the hours of 3 am and 4 am for whatever reason. over great and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, bright and cheerful and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: xxxOntariCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at this hotel before and after any flights out of Toronto for many years. Their remodeling was done carefully and now it is bright, cheerful and clean. The staff are excellent ,always welcoming us back and greeting us as if we were old friends . We would recommend this hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “OK. could be much better”
Reviews.Author: devaughn1972
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for a short get a way and was somewhat disappointed in what I received. The location was great, the service was great but the condition and facilities need work. I expected some problems but to have a TV that was holding on to the screws by a prayer and towels that look as if they should have been thrown away long ago, I was a lil disappointed. I will give the staff credit, they were exceptional and attentive, but it does not make up for the things that should not be over looked. I would stay again, hopefully the GM reads the reviews and makes the much needed improvements

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Spase M
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for Christmas Night. Yes Christmas! I had really hard time choosing the best hotel for my needs and price range and I am proud to say: I made the best choice! The staff was more than welcoming, charming, friendly, kind and warm! The Room was simply amazing! Big bed, nice sheets, really warm and clean! ps: they make the best breakfast eVer!

Reviews.Title: “OK room, but too noisy, not for vacationing”
Reviews.Author: whirlwinding
Reviews.Content: Good: Interesting decoration in the room. Modern and northern European feeling. Room size is good, and room is clean. Flat screen TV. Parking Garage is connected to the hotel. The hotel is close to high way, but itself pretty isolated. No shops, restaurants near by in walking distance. The airport is across the road. Bad: Requires $10 for parking each day. Directly under the landing path of Ontario Airport. On the top of the garage, you could see planes landing, very close to the hotel's roof, within 100 feet (?) away from you. The noise isn't as bad as I thought it would be, and it quieted down after 11pm, but you could clearly hear planes flying by, and it's noisy. The ATM in the lobby only took Canadian ATM cards, not US ones. All in all, it may be OK for a one night lay over for a business traveler, but for folks vacationing in Toronto, there are better choices for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing airport hotel CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: T15T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with hesitation last week due to an early flight. I am a 5star snob and I have to congratulate this hotel on a great concept! The place is new, stylish and clean. The service was wonderful but a young man working at the front desk. I was really happy with the price of this place for a quick night's sleep, in a stylish and comfy room I would have paid 4 times for in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: catchgps
Reviews.Content: Good business Hotel, nice spacious rooms. Swiming pool inthe basement. only problem is that you have to change lift while going to 5th floor from 4 floor. Good value hotel for people visiying for business. Very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo near the Toronto Pearson airport”
Reviews.Author: RFOXY
Reviews.Content: New decor with an upscale feel for a great price. I had a 13-hour layover in Toronto and this is just what I needed. Free airport shuttle. I am not into adult entertainment but if you are there are a couple of strip clubs within walking distance. But the neighborhood is not seedy or dangerous, it is close to the airport and a bunch of hotels are around. Very good value. Highly recommended. If you are a tourist staying in Toronto you probably would want to stay somewhere more convenient to whatever it is that Toronto has to offer, but for my purposes, a good night's rest before my morning flight, this was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to hwy - poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: bergamo4you
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've been to this Hotel during my business trip in Toronto. I find it quite useful because of the easy access to the 401 and 427 Hwy due to the fact that I've to go to visit my customers spreaded out in GTA. I also like the large pool in the basement to have a bit of relax. Even if the Hotel is located at the beginning of the landing strip and you can almost touch the airplanes while landing (or taking off), the rooms I've been were quite properly acoustically insulated. I personally found every time friendly personnel at the reception and ladies always smiling and ready to help me when I needed to print out some documents. Now the negative aspects: I've eaten at the restaurant three times (in a full week stay) because I was too tired to go out and find a good one. The restaurant is very poor both for the menu that the service. At the third night i had my difficulties to decide what to eat. Even the breakfast looks bad and the service is really unpolite and slow even if there are few people in the restaurant. The rooms I've found during my previous two stays were good, but in the last one I got the maintenance was really poor: there was a huge bump on the wood floor (few inches high and along the whole lenght of the table) underneath the table and the chair did not remain in place because of that. I never saw anything like that in any Hotel during my several business trips in North America (I'm a Priority Club Platinum member by the way). Moreover the hose of the shower has been replaced but not chromed so looked bad with all other faucets chromed. The shower faucet was also leaking constantly. Honestly, I don't know if I'll be back again to this Hotel or I'll go back to the Holiday Inn nearby (former Holiday Inn Select).

Reviews.Title: “As a last resort only.”
Reviews.Author: DanielKOBrien
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the Toronto airport but that is the only feature it has going for it. From YYZ, there is a free shuttle that makes you feel like you risked your life to get there! It's a beat up old, stinky van, and the drivers drive as if they are being chased by the cops. There is nothing of interest located near the hotel ie. no good shops or restaurants or anything at all. The rooms are clean enough but not exceptionally nice. They have been renovated in the last year or so. If you have any problems, good luck. Staff is poor all around.

Reviews.Title: “2 Nights at Indigo”
Reviews.Author: FatherofIssac
Reviews.Content: Pro: Easy access to the highway, friendly staff and clean rooms. Con: No special ammentities to frequent Priority Club Elite members. Needs upgrade available for elite members.

Reviews.Title: “dont ever try this property”
Reviews.Author: Timothy C
Reviews.Content: poor service ,Tam hafaz the manager it is not professional at all i thing its bad attitude,dirty i had a problem with my t.v. nobody can fixed at night nobody of maintenance to help , liking on the ceiling, totally a bad experience , i never recommend this hotel to anyone Shareef the receptionist very bad, he charge me twice on my credit card, it was a big problem to get my money back i don't know how they pretend to be a part of IHG property. sorry guys bad service bad qualifications

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Review”
Reviews.Author: travelagent1985
Reviews.Content: We (four travel agents) stayed at this property for one night, mid-week. We had two rooms with two agents in each. The room with one king bed did not seem to have the problems the room with the 2 beds had: -The hardwood floor was not laid correctly and was buckling against the wall on one side of the room, creating a small 'hill' of sorts next to the wall. -One of the beds had black hairs all over the sheets and the pillows, and the comforter had stains on it. The pillows themselves were very flat, although each bed had quite a few so you could stack them to make them more comfortable. -The service, or lack there of, for breakfast the next morning was the worst I have ever experienced! We waited for a half an hour before anyone ever acknowledged us, and only after flagging down the manager, that could not help us either as it was only his second day. He eventually had the waiter come over who in turn was very abrupt and tried to tell us to just order the buffet as it was busy, and was less then impressed when we let him know we wanted to order off the menu! The CHEF did come over to check on us after we had received our food, and apologized for the delay in service due to the unexpected rush they had experienced. (The "rush" was maybe 3-4 other tables of people that were either forced to eat the buffet or waited forever to be acknowledged to order off the menu.) As a gesture from the hotel, they offered us a free cup of coffee or glass of juice!?! Also, there were some other tables that had dirty dishes all over them, and a huge spill on the floor that just had a napkin placed over it. We ended up giving our coffee mugs to two other ladies trying to get service, who ended up getting their own coffee, and then giving up and leaving after not being acknowledged. The breakfast experience was AWFUL and made us very close to missing our morning meeting for trying to get something to eat! -The carpeting in the elevators was stained all over. -The shower knob was very hard to turn on and we were scared to put too much pressure on it for fear it would come off the wall. Cold and hot were backwards as to what they were labelled on the knob? -We ended up driving past the hotel as the name was not even lit up to help us find it! Overall, not a pleasant stay, and as a group we decided we would not be sending clients to this property. Given there are so many airport hotels within the same price range and at a better location, we would certainly use the other properties first!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, We will be back again!!”
Reviews.Author: northerntravellergir
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we flew home as we always do when in Toronto. The room was clean and very modern, the staff were great. The shuttle is awesome too especially because it is only like a 5 minute ride to the aiport and unlike other hotels that charge you for the shuttle it was free. We will definately stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will probably not be back either”
Reviews.Author: smokedmeat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, August 7. Reserved one room with Priceline at the nightly rate of $43 USD. This was not the hotel I was expecting, and I was not to optimistic after reading some reviews on this site. Still, the price was good for a short stay. After flying to Toronto at 2:00 a.m. and picking up our car from the Park'N Fly lot (paying half price using a Payless Airport Parking online coupon), we were relieved to find that the hotel was just down the street from the parking lot. We checked-in and found a spot in the adjoining garage. Hotel parking is $10/day, but is half price for Priority Club Platinum Elite members. A day earlier, we received a phone call asking if we could be switched from an accessible room to a king room, which was not a problem for us. Our room (430) had a large desk, sofa chair and ottoman, along with a flat screen TV, coffee machine, mini refrigerator and in-room safe. One wall had quite tropical wallpaper, and the floor was hardwood. The room was quite fine except for a small hole in the door. The bathroom was a good size with a large mirror and counter. However, it only had a stand-up shower with a detachable head that could not be steadily fixed to the wall. Also, the back half of the shower was open (the front half had fixed glass), so water easily sprayed out to the bathroom floor. There are two free Internet terminals on the ground floor, but the keyboards are the worst that I have ever used. The keys need to be firmly struck and sometimes do not register. I assume that these are used as a deterent to theft, in which case they do a fine job. The Hotel Indigo is located next to a Moore's menswear store and is also a few blocks away from a Hooters restaurant and the Landing Strip and Spearmint Rhino gentlemen's clubs. Families will be best advised to avoid this area. I would not choose to return to the Hotel Indigo if possible but for the price and what I needed (a good night's sleep), the hotel was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: oc3anz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly on the landing path for Toronto International Airport, so if you get freaked out by planes that seem only meters above your head, this isn't the place for you! However, it was exciting to see them landing, and although we could hear them in our room, they stopped about midnight and we got a great night's sleep in the surprisingly roomy but European-feeling room. The complimentary airport shuttle leaves on the half-hour, even at wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “Different, fully satisfactory, good value”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere1949
Reviews.Content: Reception efficient. Room well equipped. Free wifi. Interesting laminate floors instead of carpet â€“ only problem is desk chair has â€œcarpetâ€� wheels, not hard floor wheels, so almost fell off the chair when it ran away from me. The bathtub has been replaced with an oversized shower. The towels looked like they've been in service for way too long. Clean and quiet. Decor throughout the property is â€œdiscount boutiqueâ€�. PHI Bistro â€“ I have no idea what the acronym stands for. Although the menu was limited, the food was surprisingly good. I had the Balsamic Steak and Salad, and my partner had the House Burger with fries. Service was very good. Decor early Walmart. Lots of use of laminate flooring throughout the property, which in places was lifting from the sub-floor which made it weird to walk on. Overall for the price both the room and restaurant were a good value. Would I return? - maybe, but only if my other favourite Toronto airport hotels were not available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location, but beware of pillows!!”
Reviews.Author: TOtravlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our flight out of Pearson the next morning. The hotel lobby was clean and modern and the room was equally clean and attractive. We only spent the night here so I can't comment on any of the facilities the hotel has to offer, but the shuttle was prompt and efficient. The only problem we experienced was that whatever the type of feather is in the pillows caused both of my sons to have a severe allergic reaction. When we called the lobby to let them know they sent up feather free pillows, but at this point they were already itching and uncomfortable. So if you have any type of allergy to feathers I would make sure to request feather free pillows from the time you check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need before a long flight!”
Reviews.Author: Bec17
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo is an oasis of calm before entering the busy world of airports. You will hear planes flying overhead at all hours, but the hotel itself is whisper quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room (king single, non-smoking) was pure luxury for such a low price - impeccably clean, bright, roomy and had everything you could need. The interior design is artistic - with aviaton-themed photographic murals and the haiku poems to explain hotel services are a quirky touch! The restaurant serves a limited menu, but the Chicken Caesar Salad I ordered was delicious and generously portioned. The airport shuttle is quick and convenient. My bed was everything a hotel bed should be - massive, with crisp sheets. Unfortunately, even though I had a non-smoking room, my pillows did smell of smoke - it's possible a previous occupant didn't follow the rules. Free papers at your door in the morning, lots of TV channels to flick through - it'll definitely be my pre-airport hotel of choice if I'm there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor and rooms, there are better airport locations”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo for a quick overnight trip. The hotel appeared to be new or newly renovated. The rooms were kitschy but nicely designed comfortable and well appointed for the price. The biggest downside is the location. We took the free shuttle bus from the airport, which brought us to the hotel quickly enough. While the hotel is near enough to the airport, it is in a business park and there isn't really much of anything around that you can walk to. We had to take a cab (only $6) to get to the Lone Star Grill or The Keg. After dinner we set out for a night cap in the resto/bar, which has no atmosphere. It is decorated a bit like somebody's basement but more interestingly there was no notable music or TV to speak of. There was one staff member who appeared to be working and even though she saw us, she spent about 5-7 minutes setting tables in the restaurant before coming to serve us. Sleep quality was good but one thing I noted was that the bed seems to have a traditional hotel bed spread on it. You don't see those very often anymore. I briefly visited the fitness center, which consisted of three cardio machines and a cable weights machine. The basement level was not air conditioned and it was quite hot in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the airport, although not well known”
Reviews.Author: VATraveler55
Reviews.Content: The Hotel indigo is a smallis, well appointed hotel very close to the airport. The pros: it's a very nice property, comfortable and about 10 minutes from pickup to dropoff. It's part of the Intercontinental/ Crowne Plaza / Holiday Inn group of hotels and participates in the Priority Club awards plan. The cons: It's at the approach end of the runway, which gives you an intimate communion with arriving aircraft. This only lasts until about 11PM however so it doesn't particularly interfere with normal sleeping. It's also not particularly well known by taxi drivers so use the provided shuttle. Note the shuttle runs on the half hour but significantly less than several competitive hotels which leads one to think they may have been forgotten. It's probably a good idea to take the telephone number of the hotel with you to confirm shuttle schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Different from your regular hotel, Love it!”
Reviews.Author: IndoVaca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice this month alone in this hotel... tried both room w/ king size also double queen bed room First time very little expectation, just thought we give it a try.. Front Desk was very friendly, check in took less than 5 minute. First Impression of the lobby...bright, modern and refreshing... We were just surprised how nice the room were, when you opened the door you get this fresh feeling, love how the combined the colors.. we have stayed in several hotels that are double the charge ,.surprisingly this small hotel has a flat tv and furnitures are modern as well as the bathroom. i know on the other reviews the walpaper on one side of the wall for me personally i think it's nice...it's different retro kinda look.but hey still the room is much nicer than the hilton or toronto delta. Aveeda was the toiletries which is an extra touch unlike some other hotels with no brand cheap shampoo/lotion that smells horrible. we used all facilities they have...fitness centre..small few equipments but enough to work out a sweat.. pool...warm , nice good size, they left plenty extra towels by the pool hot tub..it's ok but not enough power/bubbles dry sauna...gotta allow 15 min before u get in wet sauna..now this you gotta try, . me and my husband just loving this ... and fyi again you dont find a lot of hotels that has both dry/wet sauna parking..yes it's $10 but other airport hotels in the area charge about $15-20/night (we checked)..check out was a breeze.. quick tip ..per other review , the 5th floor was just added and access only by stairs but last time we were there they just had a separate elevator from 4th floor goint to 5th floor. or just ask them not to put u on 5th floor simple as is. so...for the price that they charge this hotel is absolutely worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Room Door Would Not Lock - still alright for price and airport location”
Reviews.Author: redbaron41011
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the airport. Although the decor is updated with flat screen TV and modern shower-only bathroom (no door on shower, just a partial glass wall so water sprays out onto the bathroom floor), the beds do not have the new pillow top softness and the rooms are small - but still okay. Free wireless works good, but no refrigerator, no microwave and no hair dryer in my room. Five floors and to get to the fifth, you have to get off at 4 and take a separate elevator up the rest of the way! Breakfast in their restaurant is limited, but very tasty. Parking fee for hotels at the airport is outrageous: $10 to $15 per night even for guests and Indigo's was $10. They have their own garage and are off airport property, so they are just gouging. Nothing within walking distance except a strip club, Hooter's and the Arizona Bar and Grill (food was fair to good and Veronica was sweet). Overall not a bad hotel and folks are nice (especially Amanda at the front desk). Pool seemed clean and the hardwood-looking flooring in the room was unique. I stayed 4 days/3 nights and on the second day discovered the door would not stay locked (if you gave the handle a jiggle just right, it opened). Told the desk and it was not fixed. Third day, housekeeper offered to lock with brass key while we were out and leave a key at the front desk; but, when we returned, the night desk clerk had no such key and the door was again unlocked. Glad no one took our laptops and jewelry! Guess this is why they have a safe in the room! On top of that, that same night they had cancelled our electronic key card, so we could not enter the hotel from the parking garage and had to carry all of our luggage down 3 levels of garage ramps after midnight. Wife never felt safe in a room where the door would not lock, especially considering the industrial airport location, and even spent one night with a nearby relative because of it. Explained all of this to one of the managers before we left, Patrick Guzman, who offered to comp me a breakfast and parking. I stated I wanted to give the hotel an opportunity to earn my trust and would stay an extra night, but he would only comp a night's stay if I were a Priority Gold member, and I was just Priority!! Go figure! I had a Hotwire rate of $60/night+parking and tax, so I did not push it, but did check-out and stay that extra night elsewhere and will not use them again. Anytime I have had a problem with hotels or rental cars while using Hotwire, the respective management has not been very accommodating, always indicating the Hotwire booking leaves them little with which to work. Still, Hotwire has yielded very, very good deals and been helpful in the past, so I may bring this to their attention. Indigo is a good, clean place to stay provided you have transportation to get something to eat and you make sure your room door locks properly! (P.S. the best ultra modern suite at Toronto airport, IMHO, is at the Sandman Signature Hotel, and if I recall, the parking was free and if you find a special deal, you will not regret it! Great place, and not at all expensive considering what you get for your money.)

Reviews.Title: “Fine as an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jg399
Reviews.Content: This is an airport hotel, nothing more nothing less. It is located no where near anything, but other airport hotels. There is a ludicrous 10 dollar parking charge, that in my mind is there just to add dollars to the bill. Service only gets one star, since the check in person and the person at checkout were really not that interested in customer service. If you set your expectations low, it will be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: vanclan
Reviews.Content: Not sure what to expect from a Boutique Hotel. Received a great deal on Hotwire ($55.00 plus fees/taxes) on a Friday night. Warmly greeted by reception. Important note...if you are a Priority Club member (especially a Gold member) be sure and show your card at check in. This decreased our parking fee from $10.00 to $5.00 and we were given a complimentary bottle of water.... Parking is in a covered multi level garage..nice if it was winter or snowy. Appears that they have security checking the garage also. King room, laminate floors, nice and clean. We were missing soaps, but they were brought within 5 minutes of our request. Avena line of soaps shampoos were nice. Room was quite cold when we arrived, but we easily adjusted the heat/air conditioning and it responded exactly to the temp we set. Room is we3ll lit with lamps on both bedside tables 9lamps have multi settings which allow you to turn on the lower (base part) of the lamp, the lamp or both. Makes a nice atmosphere. Single serve coffee maker in room. Just an observation... Only one packet of decaf and one packet of regular coffee available. It would be handy to have two packets of each when there are two occupants of the room..but we certainly easily stretched it! Pool/Hot tub Sauna, Fitness room in basement. Hot tub was on the cool side...but that is better than so hot you can't stand it!! Did not appear to be much within walking distance ..other than a Moores Menwear Store and outlet. All staff were friendly and welcoming. A good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing and bright hotel - love it”
Reviews.Author: SpaJunky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while laying over in Toronto. Location is 5 minutes from airport. Service was very attentive and received a lovely warm welcome from the reception desk upon arrival. I didn't use any of the hotel facilities, but the hallways are beautifully lit and nicely painted. The rooms feature nice lamintae floors, clean modern lines and great lighting. Beats those depressing hotels with bad fluorescent lighting and dirty carpet! Bathroom is modern with nice full size shower and bed was comfy but a tad bit squeeky. I would highly recommend this as a airport hotel - not a destination hotel by any means but perfectly adequate and a fresh change.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: kymmy3
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay here after reading the reviews but decided to give it a try! The shuttle was waiting when I got off the flight. It was super quick ride to the hotel. The lobby is very night and the staff WONDERFUL! I was quickly checked in! My room was very nice - hard wood floors, nice king size bed and a large glass shower! The bath products were Aveda - which was a nice touch! I booked the shuttle for the morning and had no issues getting to the airport. I thought the hotel was perfect and I am already booked for a week in May for business!

Reviews.Title: “One wall with jazzy wallpaper does not a boutique hotel make.”
Reviews.Author: Vaux
Reviews.Content: So basically this is a typical, competent, clean, functional but uninspiring airport hotel in an unexciting location, which has stuck up a piece of jazzy wallpaper on one wall in each bedroom and so thinks it is a "boutique" hotel. For its purpose - an enforced airport one night stop - it was ok. I may well use again, the rates were good, the competition could be worse!

Reviews.Title: “Layover #1”
Reviews.Author: tomden
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the airport and wanting to call for the shuttle, I couldn't find the hotel in the kiosk, then I looked for the Novotel and there it was, so I was able to get my shuttle. The driver was one of the best I ever had, very polite and reliable. Check in was fine and pretty fast. The biggest surprise was to find hardwood floors in the room, that was nice. The large shower stall is also a plus but still not the nicest I have seen. The rest of the room was also very nice, comfortable beds etc. and even with airport traffic buzzing very close by it was surprisingly quiet. That was the night before the restaurant was re-localized and there was a lot of pounding and drilling in the lobby. Inconveniences that were minimized by one of the friendliest waitress who made our experience all worth it. A good word also to the cook who came to ask if the food was to our standards. All in all a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazz11
Reviews.Content: This was a Novotel at one time. There are still remnants of the typical European decor and it looks very dated. It was built with ten floors but the top five had to be removed as it was too high for the air traffic. It is now, laughingly, called a "boutique hotel" . Check in took at least 15 minutes. I was given a room on the fifth floor (now the highest floor). The only thing is the elevator only goes to the fourth floor. To accesss the next floor I had to take the service staircase which is not fun with 2 heavy suitcases and three flights of stairs. The room appeared ok with a flat screen TV and free internet. The hardwood floor had obviously not been cleaned in a while. One wall was decorated with a horrible brown maple leaf mural. The bed was comfortable. In the morning I happened to drop some coins and one rolled under the bed. When I went to retrieve it I noticed that the floor under the bed was filthy with dust bunnies and food particles that had been there for a long time. The restaurant was more like a greasy spoon cafe with absolutely no atmosphere and a very sparse menu. The staff obviously have never had training in hotel services. When I wanted to use the shuttle to the airport I was told that I should have booked it 2 hours in advance but they grudgingly arranged my transport within 15 minutes. There are much better hotels nearby so give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: meisterdon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not listed at the airport hotel info kiosk so if you don't have the phone number with you good luck. I called a Holiday Inn that was listed to get the front desk person to help me locate Hotel Indigo and ask them to send the "free" shuttle. She kindly did that and said the shuttle was on it's way. It's 0C in Toronto that night. I luckily wrote the Hotel Indigo number down and when the shuttle didn't come after 20 minutes I phoned. Oh sorry the lady at the Holiday Inn hadn't phoned back to tell them what terminal we were at (though she had asked). The shuttle will be there in 20 minutes. After that time I phone again: "It's snowing so the shuttle is having trouble getting to airport". By this time the other airport area hotel shuttles had been by us at least 3 times! Waiting again. Next call was to tell them we were taking a cab and the hotel was paying for it. Was told they would reimburse us. Nuts to that! If I had money for a cab I would have taken one right off the start. The hotel person paid the driver when we arrived. Took 1 1/2 hours to get about an 8 minute ride to Hotel Indigo. Never again! The hotel is slick looking trendy design but cheap and tacky at the same time. It's a remodel from some previous hotel. Small rooms, chipped paint, light didn't work, door had 1 inch gap at bottom, closet door wouldn't close cuz fridge was hangin out of it, cheap laminate flooring had big gaps between the slats and it was dirty. Called to see if there was room on the shuttle at 7:30 a.m. Yes, no problem. Get downstairs and front desk guy says "You didn't book this shuttle". No that's why I asked first if there was room. He wandered all over the lobby even after I had asked for a receipt for our room. My recommendation: if you like Holiday Inn properties and/or you are a Priority Club member stay at the Holiday Inn Express on Ambler Road. It's a quick 15 minute ride. They have a shuttle that is regular and they are very friendly...plus breakfast is included. All for less than Hotel Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising”
Reviews.Author: odonned
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Indigo for New years Eve and were very disappointed when we arrived to find both the pool and hot tub out of service. I inquired at the desk where the pool was and was given directions but not told they were out of service. When we went down to check out the pool there was a sign on the door that said they were closed for mantainance. How convenient on New Years Eve when the building is sold out. After complaining to the hotel via email we were given the corporate line and they did not even address the issues. PROS-the rooms are very nice at this hotel CONS-all the complaints people had are true including extremely slow service in the restaurant and inflated prices for average food. I would return to this hotel if someone would address my issues, but so far no luck. So much for customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Agent226
Reviews.Content: The location is your typical airport hotel. about 5mins away by shuttle. The hotel is quaint, clean, and quiet. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. I prebooked my shuttle because I read of the horror stories of waiting for a shuttle. I was disappointed that even though I booked my shuttle, they driver drove out of the way to pickup other customers. What should have been a 5 mins drive for me, turned into 25mins, which defeats the purpose of an airport hotel. I believe this is the shuttle company's fault for booking clients too tightly. Beds were comfortable. The Aveda products were a nice touch. I like the business center and free printed (handy for boarding passes). The showers are a modern design, however I'm a fan of baths before a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: gasp262
Reviews.Content: No issues - clean room, quiet (even near airport), free wi-fi, walking distance to a bar, a restaurant and a coffee shop, in addition to a coffee shop and restaurant on site. Cheap price (under $100) and an airport property with a shuttle. Hard to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jimmerg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night before i was due to fly back to England after over 6 months of travelling. This one night of luxury was exactly what i needed! To sum it up the room was excellent, the hotel had great facilities including a gym and swimming pool, and a onsite restaurant, free shuttle bus to/from the airport, and free high-speed internet. The staff were friendly and helpful and i thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for a budget hotel airport in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' the Indigo!”
Reviews.Author: austinwinters
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the next in my series of "refresh" reviews on hotels to avoid the dorm room for a night! This time, I have chosen to stay at the Hotel Indigo Toronto Airport. You know the rules by now, I show up at the hotel and check what their rates are for walk-in customers and see how their service lives up to their promises online. So, without further adieu, let's get started! When I was researching this hotel before arriving, I was very worried that this hotel would be a quick rehab from the shoddy airport motel it was before to just satisfy the basic requirements of a Hotel Indigo. To be fair, I had the same worry when I travelled to the Hotel Indigo Amhurst (see other review). Upon arrival, it was a very dark exterior, not too much in the way of lights. I pulled up and parked under the verandah to head in. It was a first to walk into the lobby and hear the pounding of music coming out of the conference rooms, turns out a wedding was going on. No problem, you can't hear it anywhere else in the hotel! Heading up to reception I was greeted with some scepticism which I'm used to by now. Rate searching came up with $139.00, the posted internet rate. The agent asked what I was looking for, I said "a simple King", but she meant price wise. I gave her the competitive rate at the Crowne Plaza which was $119.00 (+$14.00 for parking) when she counter offered with $109.00 with Parking at $10.00. I was very excited to hear the rate, accepted and reserved the room. When she found out that I was an Ambassador (Gold Elite) I was treated like a Platinum for some reason. I was given a $5.00 discount on parking, and a $5.00 breakfast gift card for the restaurant. Very swanky! My room was located on the 5th floor. It seems that floor 5 was an addition after the fact of the original hotel building. When I was checked-in, I was told that I had to take an elevator to the 4th floor and then another elevator to the 5th. It felt very exclusive, not a burden. The only thing was that the 4-5 elevator was small, felt a little claustrophobic. No problem, you're only in there for 15 seconds anyways. The hotel looks like it was ripped down to the frame and rebuilt. That's how good it looks. The hotel is very true to the Hotel Indigo brand, new walls, carpets, decor etc. I was very impressed from the lobby to the second I got to my room. On the room floors the only thing which wasn't replaced during the refurb were the doors to each room. They are very old and are showing clear wear and tear. It would benefit the hotel to change the doors to complete the restoration. Entering my room, I was greeted by a hardwood floored room which opened up into a very large room. Again, I was very surprised and pleased by what I saw! Newly hard-wooded floors, brand new walls with special treatment, and warm lighting. The King Bed was off centred to allow for a large sitting area which included a 32" HDTV on swivel wall mount. Unfortunately the TV remote didn't work for some reason, too bad but I was able to change the channels (slowly) using the buttons on the TV. Beside the wall-mounted TV was a large working area with a white leather ergonomic chair. Very comfortable, got lots of work done. In the washroom there was an open concept shower which was retiled and re-walled. Sink and toilet area were also newly refurbished. I really enjoyed my time at the Hotel Indigo, I can't state enough that it is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in a while! I can assure you that I will be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Boeing_cptn
Reviews.Content: Very warm and stylish design to this hotel. A lot of emphasis on green. I only stayed in the room from midnight till 6am so I felt that the $100 was steep. Maybe if I had checked in at 3 and out at noon I would have felt better. As for the rest, good hotel with 5 min shuttle to airport that runs every 30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value or your bucks”
Reviews.Author: Wendy155013
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel. It has a contemporary feel which to me is more comfortable then a traditional hotel. Hardwood and tile in the rooms which is far cleaner then carpet. Really nice bathroom.with a shower and no tub. We were planning on dinning downtown but were running late so decided to eat at the hotel. Very very good meal. My husband had a steak salad and I had the chicken ceasar salad. Both were excellent. I don't think you would be disappointed sstaying here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding "boutique style" hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: CubaFun123
Reviews.Content: I am at the Indigo right now and am in shock. I stay out here on business 20 days per year and have stayed at all the business class hotels on dixon road..... Most are run of the mill grimy budgets...yes even the hiltons...the sheraton 4 points.. marriot etc.. have stayed at them all. When I pulled up today to the Indigo I didnt have high expectations. Nondescript from the outside nothing around except a hooters and a stripjoint and and a steakhouse (arizona something). Even worse there were airplanes landing directly across the street where the runway starts. I was shocked when I walked into my room. Hardwood floors... designer furnishings... 32 inch LCD wallmount... 5 foot narrow desk.. stainless steel bar fridge... bathroom is large with the type of vanity that has granite on top and an open wood area below with folded towels. The amenities are all by Aveda. Very nice. The floor in the bathroom is stone tile with accents of glass tile. impressive. Designer lamps... They basically made it into a "boutique hotel" at a business travellers price. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. by the way....there are airbus 737s flying 200 feet above me right now landing across the street and all I can hear is the whisper of my air conditioning. My employees went to that Arizona restaurant down the street and said it was a very good dinner. I had ate in the restaurant in the hotel and it was only so so. Free internet a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnmOttawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a layover at Pearson Airport. The hotel itself is clean, the staff were friendly and the room was well looked after. Access to the airport and the 401 were easy and quick. A downside of the hotel though is that it is right on the flight path for Pearson and planes pass within meters of the hotel's roof. This can make for quite a bit of noise. The neighbourhood around the hotel doesn't have much to offer beyond a Hooters and a gentleman's club.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic suprise after a disastrous flight”
Reviews.Author: megse
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Hotwire, which is usually pretty good at picking hotels. I was looking for a hotel close to the airport because my layover was only 7 hours (which quickly turned to 3 hours because of a freak snow storm in London, UK). So when I arrived I was cranky, it was 3AM, and I had no luggage. When I called the hotel to let them know I was a late arrival, they were VERY accomadating and reassuring. I checked in with the night audit staff and they were pleasent and EFFICIENT. You could tell they cared and they knew I was going to check out 3 hours later. They not only grabbed amenities for me (lost toothbrush, paste, combed, etc), but they also booked their complimentary airport shuttle for me an HOUR before their regular service because of my early flight! The rooms are great. They are newly renovated and the furnishings are tasteful and fresh. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were spacious considering I only had a queen size bed. When I checked out, it was the same night audit agent and they were a pleasure. This hotel is simply great. It is great for commuters looking for a bed in between connections. I wish I had stayed longer, but I must admit I was pleasently suprised considering I had no idea what to expect. Hotel airports tend to be tired and old. This one is clearly a standard above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem...”
Reviews.Author: redbaron41011
Reviews.Content: Nice, unique place near the airport with a friendly and free shuttle ride. Parking in garage is $10/night and it was irritating that when friends visited, they had to pay almost a night's fee to stay in the garage for a couple of hours. Other than that, Amanda at the front desk was very sweet and helpful and they had a secure place to store luggage while we took a day trip after checking out. Safe and refrigerator in the room, but no microwave. Comfortable bed. Flat screen TV on wall had a few channels that were snowy and the open shower was a bit odd (looks like one half of a sliding glass shower door is missing and some water sprays out onto the bathroom floor...very odd. Other than these minor things, this was a great stay and very quiet. There's a Starbucks and a small restaurant, but not much in the way of family dining in the area (a strip club and a Hooter's nearby, that's it!). Rooms a little small, but nice decore, with hardwood flooring.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated; a few minor areas for improvement”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Pros: Neatly remodelled rooms with Indigo's signature trendy, refreshing designs. Super-comfortable bed. Clean hotel situated in a quiet business district 1km north of the 401 just east of the 427 with minimal road traffic. Easy access to both major highways. Gorgeous and extremely spacious bathroom with Aveda toiletries. Ideal for those wishing to avoid the hectic downtown environment while still being just 23km to downtown Toronto. Close to Pearson airport, with free shuttle service. Competitive rates. Relatively comfortable office chair and large work area. Roughly 50 channels. Quiet and efficient A/C and heating controlled on the wall. Nice pool/whirlpool/sauna/steam room area, though pool was set at 60 (!) degrees. Cons: Relatively poor soundproofing around entry doors - with a 1/2" gap at the bottom - enable hallway conversations to enter the room with clarity, further amplified by the wooden floors. $10 daily for parking in a remote business district is bizarre. TV doesn't tilt, and is situated off the bed near the window, facing the side table lamp. While the shower is nice, the 50% open design is not practical, as I found myself wiping down a good 300ml of water outside the unit after every use. Never saw a newspaper here. Elevators are extremely slow. Overall, an enjoyable experience, but many minor things would make a difference for many. Note: Commute time when heading to Toronto is unpredictable- on dozens of trips from Mississauga, the fastest drive into the city (427 to Gardiner Expressway) one can expect is 25 minutes during off-peak hours, but it can be upwards of an hour, even longer with the closure of the Gardiner. Note that through the summer of 2010 you are best to go east on the 401, as much of the Gardiner will be closed. For more info, check out: http://www.toronto.ca/transportation/road_info/index.htm

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing decor - good value”
Reviews.Author: Francos-Duf
Reviews.Content: This recently renovated hotel provides with good value and a relaxing decor. The rooms offer wood look alike floors and roomy bathroom with a modern glass shower. All rooms have a nice flat screen wall mounted tv yet some rooms have a fixed mount while some have ones that can be adjusted laterally which makes watching from the work area much easier. All rooms also have fridges and safes. Hotel also offers covered multi-level garage which is quite handy in winter with direct access to the hotel. Free reliable Hi-speed internet is free. Staff is friendly and lobby has a modern look and is quite appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but lacks "extras" that other Hotel Indigos provide”
Reviews.Author: IrishAyes8490
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here on a recent business trip to Toronto / Mississauga area. conveniently located, but not as nice as others in this chain that I've stayed at recently. Nothing bad to report, just nothing great either.

Reviews.Title: “Very precious yet sooo annoying!”
Reviews.Author: HK46
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a hotel room for one night in Toronto, and I hadn't done any advance planning because I didn't think I was going to need one. Since I don't know the city well I thought I would look around the airport, where there are always lots of hotels. I ran across the Indigo and it looked nice from the outside. It turned out to be a boutique hotel, trying to be chic, with "relaxing" decor, bamboo floors, upscale shampoos, and haiku all around. Yes, haiku. It was also not so expensive, with a AAA rate of $85 CND, so I took it. Room was very clean and nice, "shibui" (Japanese for serenity or subtlety) atmosphere. OK! But I was awakened at 3 AM by the alarm clock (that I had not set myself) and it took me a while before figuring out how to turn it off. Finally I unplugged it. Then the room was way too warm and there was no way to reduce the temperature. Finally, the shower was so precious and subtle that I had absolutely no idea how to turn it on. Believe me, I have nothing against shibui--I lived in Japan for two years and pride myself in acceptance of the culture, plus I speak a reasonably fluent Japanese. But even in Japan they try to reduce annoyances such as this. Next time I will look more vigorously for a plain old Holiday Inn. Oh, one last thing. They charge $10 for overnight parking, and even though I complained to the hotel about the annoyances mentioned above, they didn't offer any adjustments, not even when I suggested that they could take off the parking fee, perhaps? Chic has its place, but it should be coupled with customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulamac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo before our last flight to Cuba. It was a great choice. The hotel offered free parking for the week we were away plus airport shuttles to and from the airport. This made for a relaxing start and finish to our trip. The hotel was lovely. There were no carpets in the rooms which made them feel crisp and clean. The pool with warm water, hot tub, sauna and steam room were an added bonus, especially the steam room. The staff were great. Make sure you leave yourself lots of time to eat at the restaurant. There only seemed to be one person working, but they were friendly so we didn't mind. The cost was only 109.00 so was well worth it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its hip interior hides a rotten core.”
Reviews.Author: weehunter
Reviews.Content: I was flying my partner in from Vancouver and the flight was coming in late. I wanted to pick a hotel that was close to the airport and was clean. After some searching I found this hotel and the description sounded pretty neat. Upon arrival, I was happy to see it looked like it read. The rooms were pretty cool too. Hardwood floors, unique shower etc. I was felling pretty good about things, I went down to the Phi restaurant in the lobby. The food was pretty pricey, but I guess that is to be expected. What I didn't expect was a plate of hummus with some olives to take 25mins to prepare! Like another poster commented it seems like only 1 or 2 people work in the whole building. The bartender kept disappearing into the back ,I think he was the cook too. I took a shuttle to the airport which didn't seem to be a problem. Catching a shuttle on the way back however was. When I called the hotel to find out where it was they said it was on the way. After 45mins I called again and he said it had just returned and was headed out again. I didn't want to wait any longer so I took a taxi. It is a $18 min charge from the airport. I was pretty mad since it is a 5 min drive. The girl at the front counter was kind of useless so I didn't even bother to tell her what happened. I went up to the room, and the next problem arose. The walls are paper thin! We could hear everything. Sleep was nearly impossible! The next morning in the shower you could hear people showering in the next room, it was almost like they were in your shower with you. In the end, I think they could have done something cool here, but they got cheap while building the place and have horrible service due to equally cheap labour I imagine, I left feeling taken, and not getting my monies worth what so ever. It looks and sounds cool, but I would skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I received this hotel via Priceline. I originally wanted to stay downtown, but could not win a room at a Priceline rate, so I settled for the airport area. The hotel is about 20 minutes from downtown. This hotel seems to be quite new, centers more on a boutique style. The room was very clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly. There is a computer in the lobby that is complientary for checkin e-mail and printing. The only beef I had was the $10 parking fee, but since I was originally hoping for downtown, knowing I would be paying a much higher fee, it did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duchag
Reviews.Content: Had stayed there previously last Feb/09 but under renovations. Now complete the place looks great. Service unbelievable, while checking in the receptionist went into the West Jet web site and printed my boarding pass. Great place to park and fly, and reasonably priced. Airport is minutes away and shuttle is ordered at your convienance. Parking free which is one of the few that doesn't charge for this service. Small restaurant/bar off the main entrance with reasonable food. Would strongly recommend if only staying overnight before a flight. Great place.. Guy & Tracey Kingston, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Service was horrible! Please Read!”
Reviews.Author: beausoleil85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on our way to Las Vegas the night before and the night we got back. We spoke to the houskeeping manager about replaceing the down filled pillows because I have severe allergies. We were assured that there would not be any problem. On our departure stay we got to the hotel at 9PM and were quite unhappy when we realized that the hotel had not switched out the pillows. After calling we waited 20-30 minutes for someone to bring us up new pillows. Who turned out to be the same guy that drove the shuttle from the airport that night! Before departing in the morning I made sure that the front desk was informed once again of the issue and that they please make sure the problem doesn't happen on our return... I'm sure you all know what coming up next... We arrive at the hotel around midnight, were tired and ready to sleep... And voila more pillows that hadn't been changed! After calling the front desk I was asked to go to the laundry room in the basement of the hotel to go find myself some pillows! At this point I was tired, frustrated and couldn't beleive how unprofessional this hotel really is. I meet the front desk clerk where he puts up a cardboard sign that says...be back in 5 minutes... An airport hotel with 1 person working at night with how many rooms???? In the end I found some pillows myself and returned to my room. This hotel lacks professionalism and truly requires some serious attention. This is the first time I stay at an Intercontinental Hotel Group that has offered absolutely no customer service! I will never stay at this property ever again...If you are considering staying here...you might want to wait a while! There are better rates at better hotels closer to the airport anyways!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Indigo Toronto Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 135 Carlingview Drive, Toronto, Ontario M9W 5E7, Canada
